Title: Hav-Cie-Tri
DescriptionShort: This suggested 10 night itinerary includes the 3 principle heritage towns in the west of Cuba. Private Transfers are included between the towns and the itinerary can be tailored to suit different durations with direct flights with Virgin Atlantic from London Gatwick or many regional departures with Air France and KLM

Title: Hav-Vin-Las
DescriptionShort:
If you only have a short time in which to visit Cuba this suggested Fly Drive holiday provides a combination of places we are sure you will enjoy without too much driving.

There’s no need for a car in Havana as the Old City is compact and easily explored on foot with a good guide book. Almost all the hotels and Private Casas we feature in Havana are very centrally located and there are numerous escorted tours if you would like something a bit more organised. If you would like to see the sights in style you can hire an old American and driver for an hour or two and choose from the 50 or so Classic cars that wait alongside the Capitol building

Title: Hav-Las-Jib
DescriptionShort: This multicentre Cuba holiday gives a chance to enjoy the unique atmosphere of old Havana along with a few days relaxation in the beautiful countryside of the Sierra del Rosario Biosphere area at Las Terrazas. Then round off the holiday at a small private sandy cove with all the facilities of a 4* All Inclusive hotel. All our holidays are tailor made so different durations are possible.

Title: Hav-Jib
DescriptionShort:
One of our local representatives meets all Virgin flights from the UK and can assist with a taxi into the city, a short 20 minute drive from the airport. We have an ever increasing selection of Superior Private accommodation in the historic Old City and we also feature around 30 hotels in Havana and know them all first hand and can of courses provide advice and prices for any alternatives. There are numerous nearby bars and small private restaurants in the old city which offer both the best quality and the best value.


For your stay in Havana you are free to explore the city on your own or perhaps book an organised walking tour. Old Havana is very compact and can easily be covered on foot. If you wish to explore beyond Old Havana then there are taxis, rickshaws and horse-drawn carriages or you can even hire a big old American car with driver by the hour. There’s a good all day excursion to the very scenic west of the island that includes a visit to the spectacular Vinales Valley that can be booked locally and should you require any assistance or advice while in Havana we have a full time rep available.

Title: Hav-Tri-Jib
DescriptionShort: An 11 night suggestion which combines both the of the UNESCO world heritage towns of Havana and Trinidad with a few days at a 4* All Inclusive beach hotel. Any of the beach hotels in Varadero can be combined with this type of itinerary and flights can be arranged with any of the major airlines that fly to Cuba with many regional departures from the UK also available.

Title: Hav-Bar-San-Gua-Hav
DescriptionShort: This 14 night suggestion includes both Cuba’s Capital city of Havana and its second city of Santiago de Cuba in the rugged east of the island. After a few nights soaking up the atmosphere of Havana’s old city we fly you to the wonderfully laid-back town of Baracoa at the far eastern tip of the island.

Title: Hav-Cie-Tri-Cay-Hav
DescriptionShort: If you have around 14 nights then you will have time to enjoy Havana and the two principal heritage towns of Cienfuegos and Trinidad in the south of the island. The duration in each place can be tailored as you wish before taking a scenic transfer through the Escambray Mountains to Santa Clara and on to Cayo Santa Maria for a few days relaxing at one of the All Inclusive beach hotels

Title: Hav-Las-Tri-Jib
DescriptionShort: Combine the unique atmosphere of Havana’s old city with a few days in the ‘time warp’ west of the island and enjoy the rolling palm clad scenery of the Sierra del Rosario biosphere area at Las Terrazas. This suggestion then takes you to the World Heritage town of Trinidad on Cuba’s Caribbean coast for a few days before a relaxing break at a 4* All Inclusive beach hotel well away from the larger beach resorts.

Title: Hav-Las-Vin-Mar
DescriptionShort: This suggested 14 night 4 centre holiday starts in Cuba’s vibrant and atmospheric Capital city of Havana for a few days. But is then geared to those that really enjoy the countryside rather than city.

Title: Hav-Las-Cie-Tri-Jib
DescriptionShort: A longer 17 night multicentre itinerary suggestion taking in Havana and the very scenic area to the west of the island during the first 7 nights.

Title: Hav-San-Cam-Tri-Jib
DescriptionShort:
The island of Cuba is around 1300 kilometres from end to end so it’s really only on longer trips that both ends of the island can be seen at any reasonable pace. With almost all international flights arriving in Havana and with its unique heritage and history the Capital City of Cuba is a great place to start any tour. With this 17 night suggestion there’s enough time in each place to properly enjoy the distinct contrasts between the different regions of this fascinating island.


With 4 nights in Havana there’s time to explore the old city and a bit further afield to Revolution Square and the fortress of El Morro and even fit in an excursion to the spectacular Vinales Valley.

Title: Hav-Vin-Las-San-Tri-Cie
DescriptionShort: Old Havana is compact and can easily be explored on foot with a good guide book, but there are many escorted walking tours for those that prefer a more organised tour of this historic city. Hire an old American car with a driver for a few hours and see the sights in style or have a day out one of Havana’s Caribbean beaches just 20 minutes drive from the old city.

Title: Hav-Las-San-Tri-Cie
DescriptionShort:
There’s no need for a car in Havana as the Old City is compact and easily explored on foot with a good guide book but there are numerous escorted tours if you would like something a bit more organised. Almost all the hotels we feature in Havana are very centrally located and we have an ever increasing list of recommended Private Casa accommodation all very centrally located and all with private en suite facilities. If you would like to see the sights in style you can hire an old American and driver for an hour or two and just 20 minutes to the east of the old city are beautiful white sand beaches.

The tour takes in all of the highlights of western Cuba such as Havana, Vinales, Las Terrazas, Santa Clara, Trinidad and Cienfuegos.


The Essential Cuba Tour is a comprehensive tour of Western Cuba and has a number of unique features which make it our best selling tour


- Weekly guaranteed departures throughout the winter months
- Guaranteed departures on all Summer dates
- An afternoon cruising the streets of Havana in a chauffeur driven Old American car
- Dinner at the Art Deco La Fontana in Havana
- Final night performance by the world famous Buena Vista Social Club in Havana.

Title: Hav-San-San-Tri-Cie
DescriptionShort: We feature around 30 hotels and a good selection of superior Casa accommodation in the old city so you can soak up the atmosphere and explore on  foot. A good guide book is all you really need but there are numerous organised walking and bus tours of both the old city and areas of interest just outside of the centre including Revolution Square and the Fortress of El Morro. If you fancy a day at the beach whilst in Havana there are lovely Caribbean beaches just 20 minutes drive to the east, and a walk along the Malecon at sunset is a favourite pastime of both locals and tourists alike.

Title: Hav-Vin-Las-San-San-Tri-Cie
DescriptionShort: We feature around 30 hotels and a good selection of superior Casa accommodation in the old city so you can soak up the atmosphere and explore on  foot. A good guide book is all you really need but there are numerous organised walking and bus tours of both the old city and the newer areas including Revolution Square. If you fancy a day at the beach whilst in Havana there are lovely Caribbean beaches just 20 minutes drive to the east, and a walk along the Malecon at sunset is a favourite pastime of both locals and tourists alike.

Title: Hav-San-Cam-San-Tri-Cie
DescriptionShort:
From atmospheric Havana in the west to tropical Santiago in the east and with an 800 km road trip through rural Cuba in between this is a great way to spend a couple of weeks.

Most flights from the UK arrive in Havana so this is a good place to explore first. We feature almost all of the hotels in the old city and have a good selection of Superior Casas and know almost all first hand so can provide advice on what suits you best. The old city is full of interest and a good guide book is all you really need but there are numerous escorted walking tours if you prefer something a bit more organised.

Title: Hav-San-Cam-San-Tri-Cie-Las
DescriptionShort: This suggested itinerary combines both of Cuba’s principal cities with a 800km road trip through beautiful scenery and time warp towns and villages. Although this itinerary is based on 14 nights it can easily be extended by a few days to enable you to do things at a more leisurely pace or have some time at a beach resort at the end.

Title: Hav-Vin-Las-Cie-Tri-San-Cam-San-Hav
DescriptionShort: This is a comprehensive self drive tour of Cuba visiting many of Cuba’s most scenic areas and historic towns and cities.

Title: Hav-Bar-San-Cam-San-Tri-Cie-Las-Vin
DescriptionShort: Most flights from the UK arrive in Havana so this is a good place to explore first. We feature almost all of the hotels in the old city and know them first hand so can provide advice on what suits you best. The old city is full of interest and a good guide book is all you really need but there are numerous escorted walking tours if you prefer something a bit more organised.

Title: Hav-Tri
DescriptionShort:
Cuba is a large island and journeys between the key tourist destinations can be relatively lengthy. As many of these journeys pass by areas of historic, cultural or natural interest, we offer a selection of private ‘Sightseeing Transfers’ which effectively allow you to take in these various sites of interest en-route to your next destination.

These ‘Sightseeing Transfers’ are in addition to, and a bit more expensive than, our standard, point-to-point private transfers which are designed to get clients from A to B directly.

Generally lunch and any entrance fees are included on the longer transfers
